TopicTitle: Mysterious white dot and weird walking.

Articles.Content:
One day,I was returning back to Kerbin after a successful mission from Moho.

While landing,I saw this

I thought it was some kind of debris.BUT.My debris crashed into the ground a way earlier than I deployed chutes.Maybe a star? Nope,there are any other stars ._. . A scratch on screen? Nope,'cause of second screenshot:

And third screenshot.

Could it be Minmus?

If that is Minmus...Wow,this game is so beautiful

Weird walking:

I was testing out how can an engine affect a Kerbal Kerbal wasn't shot out to dramatic heights.Instead of that,he just landed on ground and...you can see what happened.

Here's an album of this http://imgur.com/a/6u9JL

Edited September 15, 2013 by JiWint
might be minmus, can by anything, you can even use a telescope on kerbin to see Eeloo
I'd be suprised if it's anything other than Minimus. I've seen it myself, and thats what I assumed it was.
It is Minmus. I see it all the time. As for that walking bug.. not so much lol. No idea what that's about. Funny looking though.

1. The white dot definitely is Minmus, zoom in when in iva view and see for yourself.

Using a telescope mod that lets you zoom in on the skybox you can even spot other planets, they are theoretically visible but too distant to be seen in vanilla ksp.

2. That is a known bug, that happens to kerbals sometimes when they fall and stand up. If you fall again it will get even weirder. You can fix it by going to the space center and loading your kerbal again.
Technically all the planets except Eeloo should be visible as stars in the sky like Minmus. Infacy Minmus is exactly what Jool should look like.

Weird, I've never seen Minmus like that. It's always barely visible.

Planets should look like bright stars and I hope Squad will fix that.
Yes, it's hard to doubt this is Minmus, just based on the colors in the speck.
